column5: Leaving for Canada in the am. Someone just told me there was construction around Virginia and there was quite a slow down. Anyone been through recently that can tell me what is going on? Thanks in advance.
I've been through there and back twice in the past month and I didn't experience any slowdowns.

According to the MN Dept of Highways and looking at a map, the area looks like it could be about 10 miles long. Just take it easy thru there and then you look back and wonder what you were worried about.

If any of you guys using that route want to "plan ahead" - you need to be aware of this "little" change that is coming. I couldn't believe that MN/DOT got into this mess!!http://www.dot.state.mn.us/d1/projects/hwy53relocation/

The area is North of Virginia before Cook. They are making the road 4 lane in the future. Goes down to 2 lanes for a few miles. Like other post said shouldn't be too much of a slow down. Ignore the post about the relocation of HWY 53 near Virginia, that is just in the planning stages & won't be happening for a year or more! Safe travels & happy fishing! Only 7 days to go for our return trip to Lac Seul! Can't wait!!! RBF
I was through there early this week and they actually stop you for a minute or two while they haul dirt across the road with big scrapers. Still not a bad deal , just a few extra minutes to the trip.
Went through today on way home from Lac Seul. Traffic was 55 mph with a couple of stops. Not very bad at all. My GPS says I lost 3 minutes.
Not much of a delay passed through about 8 times the last few weeks.
